topics.definition: A large building with many shops and stores.
topics.example: We went to the mall to buy clothes.

topics.definition: A place where goods are sold.
topics.example: She bought groceries at the local store.

topics.definition: A vehicle with wheels used for carrying things in a store.
topics.example: He pushed the cart down the aisles.

topics.definition: The person who handles payments at a store.
topics.example: The cashier gave me my change.

topics.definition: A piece of paper that shows what you bought and how much you paid.
topics.example: Don’t forget to take your receipt.

topics.definition: A reduction in the usual price.
topics.example: There was a 20% discount on shoes.

topics.definition: The amount of money something costs.
topics.example: What is the price of this shirt?

topics.definition: A time when goods are sold at lower prices.
topics.example: The store is having a big sale this weekend.

topics.definition: Something bought for less than the usual price.
topics.example: I found a great bargain on a new jacket.

topics.definition: A person who buys goods or services.
topics.example: The customer asked for a different size.

topics.definition: A flat surface in a store where items are displayed.
topics.example: The cookies are on the top shelf.

topics.definition: A room in a store where you can try on clothes.
topics.example: She tried the dress on in the fitting room.

topics.definition: To take something back to the store.
topics.example: I need to return this shirt; it’s too small.

topics.definition: A card used to buy goods and services on credit.
topics.example: She paid with her credit card.

topics.definition: The place where you pay for your items in a store.
topics.example: There was a long line at the checkout.

topics.text: Jane decided to go shopping at the local mall. She needed some new clothes for the upcoming season. First, she visited a clothing store and picked out a few dresses. She took them to the fitting room to try them on. After deciding on her favorite, she went to the cashier to pay. The store was having a big sale, so she got a 20% discount. Jane also found a great bargain on a pair of shoes. She put her items in a cart and headed to the checkout. The cashier gave her a receipt, and she left the store happy with her purchases.

topics.definition: To shop until one is exhausted.
topics.example: Jane and her friends decided to shop till they drop at the mall.
She bought some bits and pieces for her new apartment.
